q: '' He says he truly trusts his own instincts and when evaluating talent, doesn't necessarily think of himself as a person running a record company or in charge of a TV show. I just go,' I like this person.' Or in many, many cases,' I don't like this person.' That's when we have a problem. I'm normally right though, he says-- cracking a smile. high-tech sector, creating good-paying jobs.''`` As the CEO of a biotechnology company, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's initiative is extremely important to us,'' said Dr. Joan Fallon, Curemark founder and CEO. By supporting cutting edge research in the biotechnology field, and thus allowing for innovation, these R&D tax credits will help to defray the costs of basic research and clinical programs, which can be prohibitive to the small biotech companies. We at Curemark are extremely grateful for the Senator's leadership on this issue. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's proposal would expand the current credit by changing the formula to provide greater incentive for companies such as Curemark to increase investment; simplify the current credit, which is highly complicated and confusing; and

It is a set of working documents that I've never edited. In fact, most I've never reread.
